div.l: The devil made a reve to preche
Or of a Sowter a Shipman̄ or a lech
Sey forth thy tale and tary nat þe tyme
Lo depford it is half our͗e to pryme
Lo Grenewich that many a shrewe is Inn̄
Hit wer͗e al tyme thy tale for to be gyn̄
Nowe certis quod Oswold the reve
I prey ȝewe that yee wol nat ȝewe greve
Thogh that I answer and som̄ dele set his hown̄
For leful is fors fors for to sown̄
This dronkyn myller hath I told vs her͗e
Howe that begilid was a Carpentere
ꝐParaventur͗e in skorn̄ for I am one
And by your͗e leve I shal hym̄ quyte Anon̄
Right in his Chorlissh termys wol I speke
I prey to God his nek mowe to breke
He can̄ wele in myn̄ ye se astalk
But in his own̄ he can nat seen a balk
Here endith the Prologg
And here begynnyth the tale of þe Reve
At Trompyngdon̄ nat fer fro Cambrigg
Ther͗e goith a broke and ovir that abrigg
Oppon̄ the wich broke þ̉ere stondith a myl
And this is verry soth that I ȝowe tel
A myller̉e was ther̉e dwellyng many a day
As ony Pecok he was proude ⁊and gay
Pypyn he coude and Fyssh ⁊and nettis knietenietekniete
And turn̄ Cuppis wrestel and eke lepe
And by his belt he bare along Pavade
And of a swerd ful trunchun̄ was the blade
A Ioly Popper bare he in his pouche
Ther͗e was no man̄ for ꝑperel durst hym̄ touch
A sheffel thikil bare he in his hose
Round was his fafe and Camoysid was his nose
Also pillid as an Ape was his skul
He was a Market beter atte ful
